website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for Cappuccino lovers, this gorgeous machine does it all.
pros: Has the ability to grind beans
Users can choose the fineness of the coffee grind and choose from 5 brew strength levels
Stainless steel construction is elegant and easy to wipe clean
cons: Takes up quite a bit of counter space

customer_reviews.title: Delonghi and their Magnifica machines have gone down hill, save yourself the headache/$
customer_reviews.text: We have owned at least 6 Magnificas. Years ago they used to last. Now, we are lucky if they make it 2 years. The customer service which once was OK has become terrible. They don't stand behind their products. We descale often and baby our machines but they break repeatedly. With the nearest service center 150 miles away from our major city, $200 to look at it, etc. it's really ridiculous. Our basement looks like a Magnifica graveyard. We're done with them.
customer_reviews.author: Florence

customer_reviews.title: poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for a second time. I was pleased with the features. After 2 years, the machine busted again! To make a long story short I called customer service. The first representative treated me as if I was completely incapable of following simple instructions. He was incredibly rude and disconnected the call after I called him out on his attitude. The second call into customer service the representative suggested I just go drive 45 minutes away to get it repaired. Initial phone quote for servicing $300-$400. I am completely unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Robert.

customer_reviews.title: We strongly advise against buying this machine. We received ...
customer_reviews.text: We strongly advise against buying this machine. We received it on April 25th. It broke down after a few days. According to the instructions from DeLonghi we were not supposed to send it back to Amazon, but to contact them, which we did to ask for a replacement, since it was on warranty. They refused to send a new machine but demanded that we send it to California for repair. We have not heard from them since. Now we are making our morning coffee the old-fashioned way by pouring water over it.
customer_reviews.author: Sigrid Neidhardt

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this exact same model for 7 years and it served us well all those years. So when it broke down we didn’t hesitate for one minute and ordered the same model again. It lasted 2 months.... all of a sudden the coffee beans, same brand we’ve used for over a year now, wouldn’t go down into the grinder. Amazon immediately sent a new one and had UPS pick up the broken unit. Good thing we kept all the boxes. Hopefully the replacement will last us as long as the first one we had!
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Ann

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst products I bought. I believe this was used or refurbished product since the water tank had drops of water in it. Plus i was missing the dvd that was supposed to come with it. I still attempted to set it up after thoroughly reading the instructions. Well lets just say it didn’t work at all. I would never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Irena

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We are getting spoiled--perfect coffee every day. Happy we went for this model. Two friends who bought more expensive brands were envious of its capabilities (especially the frother and the no-tamping required). Easy to maintain. The hopper is perfect size (I don't see a problem with oily beans at all). We hardly use the decaf pass-through or the heated plate. I guess if I have to improve it, I'd install a larger water reservoir and also increase the size of the water catchment. Also found out our water is very low in mineral content, which means I won't have to de-calcify often.
customer_reviews.author: mc

customer_reviews.title: Constantly clogged
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this purchase. Purchased in November 2019. Liked the idea of an automatic machine. Worked great through the first descaling cycle. Has been clogging more frequently since. The beans will get stuck in the shoot and we’ll have to shut it down rinse it out and wipe out all the clogged grounds. Takes about 10 minutes to clean Each time it clogs. Took longer but we’ve gotten better at it now that we know what keeps happening. . 10 minutes of cleaning every 5 or 6 cups and constantly wasted beans is DEFINITELY NOT worth it. I would recommend something else. Not sure what we’ll get next.
customer_reviews.author: KCK1982

customer_reviews.title: We have had Three of these Machines
customer_reviews.text: This Super Automatic, is just that...It is Super. we have had them for about nine years. The first one we learned on.. Buy a water filter for your faucet, for scaling. and leave the lid to the scoop container lid open, it helps with letting the steam out, so the steam doesnt corrode the control panel. And when you are done making coffee leave the Service door open. This has made our last machine last us six years.
customer_reviews.author: Picky shopper MT

customer_reviews.title: Quality?
customer_reviews.text: I bought same model as I bought in late 1994. Yes, old machine lasted about 25 years. New machine gets trashier faster than original one. It uses 100 ml rinse, twice that as old one so needs water container refill more often as I brew one or two cups daily. Diffuser gets gunked up twice as fast as old one. I liked older display better. On bright side: coffee tastes just as great and grinder is quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Mead

customer_reviews.title: Great product but IMPOSSIBLE warranty
customer_reviews.text: In almost all respects we love this machine. It's easy to use, easy to clean, and makes great coffee. HOWEVER, pray that nothing goes wrong. Our milk frother is no longer working and we've only owned it for six months. It is impossible to get them to make good on their warranty. There is literally no excuse for not having a online warranty claim process - you are forced to call. Over two days, I have been hold for several hours to reach someone and am writing this while still on hold. Guess this is a good way not to honor your warranty....
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a month, and I love it. Took a few days to dial in the coffee grinder, the amount grinds for each shot, and the amount of water. I used to have the manual filter espresso machine, and I hated pulling shots especially when having guests over, as it was labor intensive and time consuming. With this machine, all you have to do is give it whole coffee beans, press a button and get the perfect espresso. Couldn't be any easier...
customer_reviews.author: Dan Pechiu

customer_reviews.title: The espresso would pour into the cup like honey or foam
customer_reviews.text: Hesitant to buy an automatic after my Silvia. Makes ok coffee. Never able to set the length and strength correctly for espresso. This machine does not use time tamp grind to make a proper shot. I would change my grind with the Silvia to consistently produce 2oz in 25 seconds. The espresso would pour into the cup like honey or foam. Now I get a compromise with stripes in the product. Not nearly the creama or flavor of the Silvia. Beware if you want excellent espresso. Too much compromise. I would rather do the work with my rocky grinder and rancillio Silvia. I will get my old machines back out and give this automatic away.
customer_reviews.author: GA

customer_reviews.title: Right out of the box it wouldn't power on...
customer_reviews.text: I called DeLonghi and they are shipping a new one to me. It can take up to two weeks to arrive. I asked them to speed up shipping and they said they can't... They should overnight a new one. The only reason I don't think they do this is because it must happen often.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M Lounsbury

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit
customer_reviews.text: I have had a unit for 4 years and working great. Purchased another machine in February of 2017 and it started leaking out of the bottom. Called supplier and sent it in for repair and it came back not leaking. Only use it on weekends during the summer months. Went to use it 2 weeks ago and again leaking out of the bottom. Called supplier customer support, out of warranty and said would fix for $200.00. Explained that this unit must be bad if it is doing it again and why would I pay $200.00 to fix a bad unit. No help this time. Done, throwing unit away. DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Almost 12 year old and working like brand new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact model in Feb 2008. Still working perfectly. My niece swears it makes the most perfect coffee in the world when she comes to visit. This exact machine was offered for the first time on Amazon back in 2001. Folks, that is 19 years ago and it is STILL a hot item on Amazon. New models have not pushed it aside. I would recommend considering that piece of info if you are looking to invest in a solid good expresso machine.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: ... months later and the machine still puts out some fantastic espresso. I did have to request a new ...
customer_reviews.text: Months and months later and the machine still puts out some fantastic espresso. I did have to request a new brew unit after a month but it was sent free of charge with no hassle. Very nice customer service with DeLonghi. I was impressed that the rep knew exactly what would fix the issue and had a resolution in about a minute. I am really in love with my Magnifica.
customer_reviews.author: JelloSayHello

customer_reviews.title: In LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome, high end, good quality coffee maker. I've had mine for about a month now. It is easy to use, despite it's intimidating appearance. The coffee grinder ensures that the coffee tastes fresh every time. It's not just an espresso machine and I like that there are no pods necessary. The milk steamer is a great feature for when you are feeling up for a latte. It washes itself out too and the instructions for cleaning and descaling seem relatively simple to follow. Love it and think it was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: MissM

customer_reviews.title: Could be a better
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are clean on how to assemble and use. I did not have the coffee beans so I could not test the feature. I tested espresso. It took me a few times to get it right but what I don't like about the machine is that the ground coffee ends up everywhere inside the system and this is by the design so they recommend using a fork and vacuum cleaner to clean the ground coffee. I would have expected more from the design for that type of money spent. Hopefully when using the whole beans the deposits will go into a container and not everywhere inside the system.
customer_reviews.author: Superfine77

customer_reviews.title: Decent coffee, very loud machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine as a Christmas gift. I'd say overall that it is a very easy to use machine and makes decent coffee (I would not characterize it as amazing-a bit on the weak side). The downfall with the machine is that it is extremely loud (everyone in your house will wake up when you turn it on). It also takes up quite a bit of counter space. The machine seems like it is made of quality materials aside from the milk frother which is plastic and feels flimsy. I previously was using a Jura espresso machine and went for a cheaper machine for this purchase (but maybe should have just went with the higher quality machine).
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Horrell

customer_reviews.title: Great fully automatic coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this machine for 1.5 years everyday. It’s been working great, taste is awesome, pretty easy to clean just don’t forget to now and then look all the way inside. It tells you when to descale, or empty the machine. Love the cup warmer on top. Feedback for improvement: The funnel should be adjustable even lower as it’s still splasing coffee when using small espresso cups. There are a few spots inside that are hard to reach for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: SpendTooMuch

customer_reviews.title: Update:  Broke after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Loved this machine until one day (3 weeks old) started leaking 1/2 of a cup of water in the tray, other half made coffee. Called Delonghi and they said it was defective. ugh. returned the unit and considering if i want to try another or not. Had a 10 year old Jura before this that never had a problem but they are just way out of my budget now.
customer_reviews.author: Hattie2

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Broke fast. Not worth trying
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a couple months. Then water started leaking out of the bottom corner of the machine. I ordered a new one and the new one wouldn’t even start. It started making loud pounding noises at first. So I unplugged it and restarted it. Then it said the water container was empty when it was actually full. Now I’m returning both and buying a Jura C65. Let’s see how that goes
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Easily deals with oily beans - exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I’m a picky coffee lover and here in Washington we have a very oily type of beans that usually most of the coffee machines stuck when blending. I had Saeco before that and had to return because it was always sticking with that oil mess. This one I own for a week and it deals with beans from Costco better than I expected! No problems at all.. also water reservoir is nicely done and is comfortable to use... So will be using and then update the review of something goes wrong! For now definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research on this machine and others like it. The price from a basic machine to a high end machine is pretty radical and I wanted something in between. Things I read/heard as negatives were the noise of the grinder and the plastic parts. The grinder noise, in my opinion, is pretty tame. The plastic parts are sturdy and it does not feel flimsy at all. I am really happy with the investment. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service!!!
customer_reviews.text: The coffeemaker itself is awesome! Unfortunately- after one year- it startet leaking and now it’s always wet around. I wrote them a few emails and they always gave me the number from the support. There’s absolutely NO way to talk with somebody in person!!!! I spent my time more than 5 hours in waiting lines at the phone.... they tried to sell me a health insurance and whatever. When I said “no” or pressed “2” for no they hung up. I’d never buy something from this company. NEVEREVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bettina

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent coffee quality in consecutive runs in just 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the DeLonghi ESAM3300 Magnifica coffee machine four months ago, ran the setup following the manufacturer instructions and have used only Lavazza Super Crema beans with it. While the unit functioned OK the first three months, four weeks ago it started to deliver inconsistent quality of the coffee. It could deliver a nice creamy espresso on one run while the next one would put just some lightly colored water in your cup! Big disappointment for a hefty price !
customer_reviews.author: Rose Ann

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine for 45 days and it has already broken twice. The most recent problem requires me to return the machine to DeLonghi - if they ever send me the instructions and promised. The machine is mostly made of plastic which is not what I expected given the price. I'm using a $20 french press while the machine is broken and the coffee tastes just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Doug A FTL

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for 6 months, works great, makes great coffee. Only complaint is that it is loud. Also wished there was easier way to take out beans. I only drink decaf and guests need caffeine. Taste is amazing and making cappuccino with it is a piece of cake
customer_reviews.author: NeedSpace

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker Ever
customer_reviews.text: 15 years ago, I bought this machine for $1200 and it worked until recently. I am sure it wasn't even 100% broken but I decided it was old and should retire. I bought this replacement that look exactly like my old one so it was love at first sight. This is just such a great machine. It does what it has to do, easy to set up, and doesn't take up too much space. If you're thinking about buying one, don't hesitate. Just buy it and you won't have to think about anything else when it come to coffee or espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary Smith

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I got the Magnifica to replaced the Breville Infuser I initially purchased. Magnifica is easy to use; with the “built-in barista”, i don’t have to use a separate burr grinder, measure, tamp the portafilter. Each espresso came out wonderful so far, and clean up is also very easy. I am still playing with the steam wand; getting too much “big” foam, not the microfoam I want. Overall I am happy with the purchase and let’s see how long the machine will last.
customer_reviews.author: Salty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Turned my house Into a coffee shop
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little reading and learning to figure out how to adjust, but once you get it right wow does this thing makes some great tasting espresso. Very happy with the purchase. Yes it is a little noisy, but if you want silence use an auto drip. This machine is grinding, heating and brewing your drink, noise should be expected.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Amazon replacement ESAM 3300
customer_reviews.text: I installed my original DeLonghi on 10/24/19. I was able to make 1 cup of coffee (it wa very tasty) and then the machine started to make a very loud noise and died. I contacted Amazon and they arranged for a next day replacement and pick up of the defective machine. It arrived as promised, I set it up and am now using it without any issues. Very pleased with the replacement and the quality of the coffee that it is making.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great with One Limitation
customer_reviews.text: Works easily. Replace a Bosch which was much more expensive. This one is better in every way but one. It has no way to adjust the brew temperature - medium only with a couple of lousy recommendations: (1) preheating the cup and (2) rinsing the unit with its hot water. That helps very little. I like my coffee hot so I have to nuke it after brewing. Ugg.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: This is our second one. Had the exact same model for almost 10 years. Makes a great cup of coffee. My wife would always tell me how much she misses it when she's on the road. After 10 years it started leaking, so we bought the same model since we loved the first one so much (and the price has come down over the last 10 years). We've had the new one for 2 months and still loving it. BTW: Gave the old one to a friend, he replaced the leaking tube, and is loving our old one.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond happy with DeLonghi espresso machine! It looks nice, it is not to big, works perfectly and has so many options! I am excited to start my mornings with my own coffee and to save money on everyday coffee purchase at coffee shops!
customer_reviews.author: Jovana

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work coming out of the box, return it, Doesn’t mean it was a crappy machine. But you think they test before it left the shop. And was my gift.
customer_reviews.author: D S

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with this product. Have been looking and didn’t want to spend a fortune. The grinder is easy to adjust. It’s workig well with dark roast. Great cream on top of pour. The steamer works great and is super easy to use. Parts are plastic so I’m a bit worried but not going to worry to much as it says replacement parts are easy to get. I make 2-3 espresso lattes a day. 😀
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excessive Descaling
customer_reviews.text: The machine is loud and not easy to maintain. My wife and are the ones that only use it. We make coffee once a day in the morning. I had to already descale the machine twice. I purchased the machine exactly two months ago. Within a 2 month period I had to use a descaler twice.
customer_reviews.author: Vito

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine, best coffee maker I’ve owned. I brew my own beans and this work amazing. Follow up: machine is leaking water out the bottom. Delonghi sent new tank, still leaks. They sent box to ship off for repair. Unit is not a year old yet. I’m worried about this lasting. Will be without machine for two weeks. I asked for a new one, they said no they will repair. Not happy. $600 bucks isn’t a year old.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Can't imagine our breakfast without this amazing machine
customer_reviews.text: We've had this machine for almost two years and I feel comfortable writing a review of excellence for this product. We've had so many guests to our home who have experienced its ease of use and exceptional quality performance and have gone on to buy their own units! There is nothing I don't love about this machine but the best thing is the coffee it makes - rich, full-bodied coffee that is filling and satisfying. For that reason you actually end up using less coffee and creates even more value for the consumer. ALSO very easy to maintain. Absolutely no concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great espresso, quality product!
customer_reviews.text: After a few months, I can't say enough about this espresso machine. I looked at lots of them and settled on the DeLonghi Magnifica. I am not disappointed at all. The ability to do a double shot (1 with caffeine and 1 decaf) is great. The ability to use ground or beans. The flexibility of making so many beverages in almost no time at all. If you are wanting an easy to use, easy to clean great tasting espresso maker with wonderful ability to froth milk, look no further. Great crema, great looking machine, great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Enri

customer_reviews.title: The most great expresso machine ever..
customer_reviews.text: Ooohhhhh.... I was never so happy to receive my express machine. I had this same machine for the last 6 years and I love it. So I ordered the same machine a second time. It is great... well I was sooo wrong. I unpacked and set it up and upon making my first cup....it blew up.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Jenner

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself already many times over
customer_reviews.text: Going Strong for 5 months! I make at least three espresso/latte's a day. It has held up great. Very automatic, just put the beans and H20 in and it does the rest. Milk steaming is a breeze. I cannot buy a better latte than I can make now. Worth every penny. UPDATE 13 May 18: Still works perfectly, making at least 3 a day for 10 months! I buy Starbucks beans and enjoy 2 in the morning at home and take a double latte to work with me in my covered thermos. My staff stops off to buy their coffee, mine is just as good! Way more reliable than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H.

customer_reviews.title: DeLonghi Delightful
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd espresso machine I have owned and this is by far the best. It is not over engineered and is designed in an intuitive way to operate right from the first cup of espresso. I like you can use whole or ground coffee and make a variety of drinks, although I usually settle for an espresso. I wish the water was hotter but have learned to drink it quicker, which is not something in America we usually do. So far, I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kfeldi

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the same model purchase 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an ESAM3300 from BB and Beyond 10 years ago that was a clearance display. It finally died. Parts were no longer available. Saw some mixed reviews on Amazon, but purchased a replacement. The new one came, and had some issues.I called Amazon, the associate I spoke to said I will send you the return approval, and get a replacement out to you immediately. I had a new one the next day! It works as well as my first one. Love this coffee /expresso machine!
customer_reviews.author: stephen a. craco

customer_reviews.title: Leaked substantial water from bottom after owning for 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Serious electrocution hazard. DeLonghi wasn't helpful and Amazon was horrific in customer service. Though the water leakage issues (roughly 1/4 cup after making a cup of coffee) happened during the 2-year warranty, they started after the return window. All Delonghi stated they would do is 'refurbish it', not good when the product is already 'lemon' with problems so quickly out of the gate. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Good option for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee, easy to handle, size of the machine is still reasonable for a home kitchen. It would be better if the milk frother had a seperate bin to catch drops and clean though, since every time I use the frother the milk that remains on the frother drops into the general bin and makes cleaning more complicated and necessary much more frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia Mausen

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Its a great machine. This is the second one I owe. First one did not break we just moved from Germany to the USA. It is a little loud but that does not change the great coffee it makes. If you are new to Fully automatic. Get this beauty. It is so easy to figure out and all. Once you found your favorite setting its all easy peasy from there. even the cleaning of the product is simple as all hell. Enjoy the freshly grinned coffee all damn day if you will. I sure know I am :D
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Delonghi coffee maker The best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is super it makes the best coffee I have ever had. I already have one and have had it for several years. This is my back up just in case I have any problems as the current one is quite old. I can not imagine not having any other coffee other than what comes out of this magnificent machine.
customer_reviews.author: Miss muffy 4x

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: waste of money, espresso very sour, the machine cant handle brewing on the fine ground setting and anything above that tastes really sour. also super loud and temperature not high enough. i know this isnt like the best of the best but for 500 bucks it should be able to produce a halfway decent shot
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Needs bigger water tank
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about a year now and still love it. Just wish the water tank would be bigger. I can make three big cups (double cups) before it needs refilling.
customer_reviews.author: Kerstin P.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Easy Brew!
customer_reviews.text: This was our first step from a drip coffee maker and I can’t express enough how delighted I am with my first cup of coffee in the morning! Simple and easy! My coffee comes out with a rich crema, warm and tasteful. That it has the ability to use grounds makes it all the more a delight when I am out of beans.
customer_reviews.author: kkb

customer_reviews.title: The whole family loves this machine
customer_reviews.text: My whole family loves this machine. It is easy to maintain, incredibly easy to use, and makes a fine cup of espresso. Over the decades, we have moved from stovetop cafetera to drip machine to a series of french presses to, finally, the ultimate ease in coffee making. Here's what's great about this: if someone needs one more cup of coffee, just push the button! There's no more eyeballing each other as you reach the bottom of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: G. Price

customer_reviews.title: Honoring Family♡
customer_reviews.text: My Elegant Stepmother Joyce Pell had this AMAZING Machine. She passed away on July 22nd of 2017. Of Pancreatic Cancer. I bought this very expensive machine not only to have in memory of our many visits over SPLENDID Coffee! But. Because I do not think you could find a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Lila Faye

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had a Saeco espresso machine for 12 years with absolutely no problems. I purchased this machine and have had nothing but problems. First, the grinder is constantly breaking and not working correctly. I’ve done everything to try and fix it, but it fails nearly every time I use it. Secondly, the water holder is small and needs to be filled every other day. The machine does not feel like it’s made with quality grade materials. It feels cheap and flimsy. You get what you paid for....by the time I discovered all of the problems it was past my 30 day window for return. Do not buy this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Graham

customer_reviews.title: For Coffee Lovers
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this machine for 1 yr, and love it. Each morning it makes a fantastic cup of fresh coffee. We have found that the beans you use have a huge impact on the quality of the Coffee. We have been buying Hawaiian coffee beans, and they are some of the best. This machine allows a person to adjust how fine the beans are ground, the quantity of water used, the strength of the coffee. I would buy this again and recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: great gift idea!
customer_reviews.text: my sister uses this machine every single day, multiple times a day now. She used to go to Starbucks on a regular basis, but after investing in this espresso machine, I really think it is worth it in the long run. It is also easy to learn how to do latte art with this machine, I love the quality and appreciate how sleek the design is!
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine and Paying for itself!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about two weeks now and my wife and I make 8-10 shots every morning. I can make a great iced latte for this summer heat in about 5 minutes or less and it tastes great,. Not to mention it is quicker and cheaper than SBUX. Currently using Peets Big Bang coffee and it is great. Highly recommend. I bought this because of the great reviews and the longevity this machine seems to last for. Clean up is simple!
customer_reviews.author: JT52

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee, occasional hiccups
customer_reviews.text: This coffee machine is for espresso lovers. It easily grinds beans and makes a delicious coffee drink to enjoy in the morning. The only cons are that it is really loud and after a year or so it needs a deep cleaning (beyond the decalcification process).
customer_reviews.author: Julie Kim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Machine is very very loud. Has smaller capacity than my previous machine and requires frequent taking apart, cleaning, drying, refilling. Beans that came with the machine make a thin/weak tasting cup. I refilled it with the espresso beans we are accustomed to. Perhaps I will be more satisfied after I have worked with it awhile. It can only be returned if unused. I'm disappointed. Probably best to buy only if you have had an in-store demonstration and find the coffee acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryne C Hengstenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great codffeemaker
customer_reviews.text: love this coffeemaker ! The taste of coffee / espresso is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Axel G Kakuschke

customer_reviews.title: Failed in a week
customer_reviews.text: Not like my last Magnifica machine that lasted 11 years. This one returned after only 7 uses. Junk!!! Won’t grind beans, red light on for low beans, nothing will grind. Returned for refund. Don’t buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for 3 weeks now, it is an amazing machine. Great coffee, easy to change settings, everything you could want at an agreeable price. No wait from espresso to steam makes morning prep time about a minute (warms up in under 5 minutes from being off). Makes a great espresso shot and steams milk very fast. I took off the outter steam wand attachment, so i can use the tip to make the foam the way i like it, it works awesome. It is as loud as a normal burr coffee grinder, no surprise there.
customer_reviews.author: notamasterchef

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker!!
customer_reviews.text: I like that you don't have to do a clean cycle every few days. I like that it doesn't shut off for hours. It makes a great cup of coffee and the price is right! I just got my second one for another house. I've gone through so many Seaco machines I can probably buy the company. This is lasting so far and I want to share this because other people probably have the same issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald L Jenny

customer_reviews.title: <3 it so much!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my boyfriend as a birthday present, and so far we love it! Never had a problem since we bought it in October 2018. I waited about over 4 months to write a review. Overall very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to operate, clean, and maintain (refilling water and beans). Makes great coffee, but of course that depends entirely on the type of beans you use. I used to have a Jura machine, which eventually died after about 9 yrs, after 2 do-it-yourself repairs. It had some extra features that I liked, but it was impossible to clean the brewing unit, the coffee was not better, and it cost twice as much. The Delonghi has some nice features that the Jura didn’t, as I discovered after using it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: DD in SD

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now, it's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Such a great investment. Well made machine and easy to use. I'm truly not disappointed. Prior to this machine I was going to Starbucks daily. Now, I only go once or twice a week; that's mostly to get outside the office or to socialize....I can't take my machine with me during those times.
customer_reviews.author: realjenn

customer_reviews.title: Poor experience with amazon on buying 2 coffee machines. Spent over $1,100.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 DeLonghi coffee machines. I’ve used the same machines for the last 10 years. Both machine had problems. The first one doesn’t warm up. I have to put my coffee in the microwave after it is made. The second one, has a scratch in the front and doesn’t warm up coffee either. I’ve had the same brand for 10 years. I know how to work it. Very disappointed with amazon customer service. They were referring me to the owner manual. They didn’t even acknowledge the scratch on the machine.
customer_reviews.author: fariba gharai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Had a Jura Ena 9 for several years and was very happy with it. Needed a replacement... Jura was my first choice considering the experience i had before. I ordered 3 different Jura, One for more than 3 times the cost of this DeLonghi, all were defective or failed within 2 weeks. Had this machine now for over 2 months and it makes EXCELLENT coffee, Espresso and great froth
customer_reviews.author: Nononsense

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is our 4th Magnifica that we have owner over the years. Our experience is that with daily use we can expect 3 years or so out of it. Very good price. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G

customer_reviews.title: Delonghi should be your #1 choice!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this machine less than 1/2 a day, but I am already so much more impressed with this than the Gaggia Anima i had but returned. Coffee is hot from this, espresso tastes great and it came with a DVD with instructions and booklets with instructions. I should have bought this one first, but I wanted the shiny one with a screen! Such a waste of money! I will update this later when I've dialed in everything and tried the frother.
customer_reviews.author: Doug McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Malfunctioning Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have had chronic problems with this machine. Descaling doesn't resolve weak coffee strength. Grinder stops working, steamer stops working....after the first few months it became useless! Trying to find a repair center is impossible. Do yourself a favor and buy a Nespresso.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey for its cost
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it has a built in grinder there’s an option too for grind beans already but max of one scoop only you can’t put that much on the container. Machine too loud I can hear it till our bedroom when my husband makes his coffee. It has auto cleansing machine which I don’t like coz I need keep refilling the water container. Over all it’s too pricey but it makes good coffee but not really a good coffee machine
customer_reviews.author: Erika Paula

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a 10 year old Delonghi that was starting to show it's age although still made decent coffee. A bit of TLC keeps these machines operating for a long time. I use beans and my wife uses grounds; the coffees are equivalent to the local Italian bistro. Also, the user manual is detailed and easy to follow. There are several good videos on YouTube if you need further info to make up your mind.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso brewing system.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for my DeLonghi ESAM 5500. I miss the automatic frothing of the 5500, however, with the addition of a Nespresso milk frother the ESAM 3300 does the same job for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Floridaphilip

customer_reviews.title: My two cents
customer_reviews.text: Great Machine. A couple of ‘wishes’ this had 1. A frothing wand that tilted. Most machines you could angle 45 degrees. 1 Bigger water tank. Takes 2 bottled waters to froth milk and make two shots. The plastic frothing cap works too well. Try removing it and see if it suits your taste.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Weak coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. Weak coffee. Doesn't hold a standard mug. In order to get the strength I wanted I had to straight espresso shots and even then, it was weak.
customer_reviews.author: K. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to drink more coffee
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars because it does what we wanted it to do. My wife is the coffee drinker in the family and she is trilled with it. (Thanks goodness, cause it was her Christmas present). She became familiar with them while visiting her sister in Germany. The only problem I see with it is that she drinks twice as much coffee as she did when she used the old style coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: D. Welborn

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with it!.....It was a big splurge for me. I'm not someone that HAS to have caffeine or coffee every day - but years ago a friend of mine had a nice espresso machine & the taste was amazing! Typically I put cream in my coffee but the espresso tastes so great by itself that I don't always put cream in my espresso anymore. I especially like the frother & the ability for me to have it make hot water for use with tea lattes. So very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Michal

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable grind, satisfying results especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to replace an old Saeco (15 years, A+) to generally pull cups of American. Took a while to settle on a final choice but this was it. Adjustable burr grind, cup warmer, solid build, setting for water hardness, relatively quiet and easy to handle for cleaning. So far, excellent, especially at this price point. If it goes sideways I’ll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Horton

customer_reviews.title: This is our second Magnfica - a replacement of our ...
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Magnfica - a replacement of our first. Out first was flawless and lived up to its name serving us for over four years without dissapointment. This replacement has a grinder that consistently blocks - grinding air rather than beans. Those few beans it manages to grind end up in our cups. I don't know what happened? Two identical espresso machines - two very different levels of performance.
customer_reviews.author: John A MacAskill

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat for the price
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't afford to replace my last machine when it broke, which was $1100+ but I bought secondhand from a friend. This seemed like a well reviewed and affordable option, and I actually love it as much if not more than my last one. I've been using it for about a month and it is easy to clean, easy to use, and makes a great shot of espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Bouchelle

customer_reviews.title: De’ Longhi excellent products company
customer_reviews.text: 6 gold star’s, My first unit lasted 8 years. Quality built, reliable, easy to use, value price Excellent cappuccino and regular coffee The best at customer service
customer_reviews.author: William D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Amazing machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg where do I even start? My dad has had the same expresso machine for 14 years, so we decided that he needed a new one for Christmas, I put it together and it was so easy to get to use. We haven’t used the grinder but the rest works amazing! I love how easily it was to learn how to use!! Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Corinna

customer_reviews.title: Happy to Have a Great Cup of Coffee Once Again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased upon receiving a raving recommendation from a colleague. The machine is exactly what I expected. Setup was easy, but I do recommend reading carefully so you can input your hard water level correctly the first time. The few cups we have enjoyed thus far have been great. I will heat milk in the microwave before frothing to ensure that my beverage is hot otherwise, it will be cold. I'm a happy coffee drinker once again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supper super happy
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to wake up in the morning and make a cup of good latte and it’s easy to use. Set up is piece of cake. Make sure you clean your steamer really good after each use
customer_reviews.author: Raya

customer_reviews.title: Machine has issues
customer_reviews.text: Do not but this machine . I’ve had to send it back for repairs 3 times now . The machine leaks water onto the counter top . The grinder is starting to not grind as well. When it does work correctly you can get a decent cup of coffee . I also need to say that the factory warranty people are nice . They have no issues with seeing the problems and sending a pre-paid box to send the machine back for repairs . It usually take 2-3 weeks to get the machine back .
customer_reviews.author: Dan T.

customer_reviews.title: MORE COFFEE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This is the greatest Christmas gift I've ever given to my wife, the coffee addict. Push one button and it spits out great espresso with no effort on your part. Well there are somethings you need to do like fill it with water and coffee from time to time. It does have lights that go on when you need more coffee, water or have to empty the waste. When we have a house full of guests that when it really comes in handy. Great product so far. I did buy the extended warranty just in case because it is a very expensive appliance to have die in less then a year so I'm covered for 4 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Lwarkentin

customer_reviews.title: A good fresh ground bean coffee maker.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good economical machine to make single cups of coffee with beans freshlyground. I would purchase this machine again and I recommend it. Good value. Durable. Performs well.
customer_reviews.author: John Gronski

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: We really like this machine and, in the one instance for which we needed to contact deLonghi for customer service (18 months after purchase), it took a few days for them to respond (Covid affecting workforce), but when they did, they patiently walked us through resetting the infuser and replaced one part that had a slight issue. Really good service, really great coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, dependable machine
customer_reviews.text: We bought this same machine 13 years ago. It has been awesome! It started having some sensor problems and so I decided it was time for a new machine. I didn't look for a different brand. I just looked to replace exactly what I had before. I have not been disappointed. Love this machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours for 9 or 10 months now. It's an expensive machine, but will save us two or three thousand dollars in a year compared to two Starbucks a day! Very easy to use, although we don't use the milk frother because we make iced lattes. Minor gripes would be the frequency of adding water and that the used grounds bin doesn't store them efficiently so requires emptying too often. No problems or failures since we've had it.
customer_reviews.author: Trebuchet

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this machine a week before Christmas and it stopped grinding beans Christmas eve. We contacted DeLonghi directly and they promised to send us out a new machine immediately. Well.... a month later we got another machine - after we returned ours to them. And here we are again, the machine is not grinding beans. I'm going to call DeLonghi again but honestly not interested in anything they have to say. I'm just very disappointed in this product and this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even though it is loud.
customer_reviews.text: Really love this product and would give if 5 stars except for one little issue: it is really loud! When I need it to be quieter, I drape a thick towel over it and that helps a lot, but it is still loud! Owned 3 years, and still going strong. After a couple of years, it does have to be lubricated about every month which is a pain since there is no easy way to get to the gear that needs silicone lubricant applied.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: espresso
customer_reviews.text: Machine does good job of brewing coffee. Areas that could be improved: espresso could be hotter. Over all a good machine for the price when compared to many others.
customer_reviews.author: gerald carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: Pump broke after one year of use. It's easy to replace so I did but the machine wouldn't reset. I called customer support for DeLonghi, but because I changed the pump myself they wouldn't help me. Now I have a very large paper weight. Apparently it's not uncommon for the pumps to fail on these things. FYI: Most machines have a two-year warranty with DeLonghi. If something breaks, don't touch it! They will void the warranty. Just set it up to send the machine to them for repairs or to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Reinhart

customer_reviews.title: 000 super automatic espresso machine
customer_reviews.text: I just sold my coffee shop with a $14,000 super automatic espresso machine. I knew that I would miss my coffee fixes more than anything. So began my search for a home system. I love this machine. It's super easy to use and makes a great latte. I have my own little coffee bar area set up and love it. I am using Starbucks espresso beans and have been for almost a month. No issues at all. In fact it steams better than my commercial machine and is easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Miller

customer_reviews.title: This machine is wonderful! Even my Italian sister in law approves
customer_reviews.text: This machine is wonderful! Even my Italian sister in law approves. You do need good beans of course for a good cup. We love the steam function and use it for the little kids a lot for vanilla milk froth. Cup size is limited underneath so half your American sized mugs won't work. Get a nice set of esp. cups to go with it and you will enjoy it more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard I.

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: love.. had to replace one we had for 15 years.. enjoy our expresso every morning and cheaper then buying it out. Machine pays for its self within the first year
customer_reviews.author: Donna Haag

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine so far, a bit noisy maybe but everything works perfect and it makes great espresso. The frother makes 10x better cappuccino than anything else I ever used in a restaurant and it's quick too. With a bit of practice you have a beautiful thick foam even when using the whole milk. I would recommend using dry beans (e.g. lavazza or illy brand) Although we tried starbucks beans at the very beginning too, the crema was there but the espresso lacked something in flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

product_meta.title: De'Longhi ESAM3300 Magnifica Super Automatic Espresso & Coffee Machine
product_meta.description:
Capable of preparing espresso, coffee, cappuccino, latte drinks, and more, this super-automatic machine features a unique beans-to-brew system that grinds coffee beans right before brewing for exceptionally aromatic espresso. The appliance comes equipped with two stainless-steel boilers that provide excellent heat distribution, as well as an instant reheat function, which keeps the machine at an ideal temperature, no matter how long the interval between cups. In addition, its quiet burr grinder automatically grinds beans and can be set to a specific grinding level, but the unit can also be used with ground coffee if preferred. 

 The unit's front panel offers easily accessible controls for the on/off switch and cappuccino system, as well as for adjusting the quantity of water and coffee to suit individual tastes, from long or short to weak or strong. Its patented cappuccino system rotates 180 degrees to allow for any size milk container, plus the coffee spigot height can be adjusted to accommodate all different cup sizes--from a classic espresso cup to a tall mug. Even more, the unit’s exclusive cup tray keeps cups warm before use, and its three-hour automatic shutoff provides added safety. Other highlights include a 60-ounce removable water tank, a handy water-level indicator, a 7-ounce bean container, an electronic steam and coffee thermostat, rinse and decalcification auto programs, and a removable drip tray for easy cleanup. Made in Italy. 

 From the manufacturer

 Capable of preparing espresso, coffee, cappuccino, latte drinks, and more, this super-automatic machine features a unique beans-to-brew system that grinds coffee beans right before brewing for exceptionally aromatic espresso. The machine makes espresso at a consistently ideal temperature because of its new stainless-steel double boiler, which provides excellent heat distribution, as well as its instant reheat function, which keeps the machine at an ideal temperature, no matter how long the interval between cups. 

 

Its space-saving, integrated quieter burr grinder automatically grinds beans and can be set to a specific grinding level, but the unit can also be used with ground coffee if preferred. Its 60-ounce removable water reservoir and 7-ounce bean container allow for conveniently filling the water tank and emptying coffee grounds. The unit's front panel offers easily accessible controls for the on/off switch and cappuccino system, as well as for adjusting the quantity of water and coffee to suit individual tastes, from long or short to weak or strong.  

The machine's patented cappuccino system rotates 180 degrees to allow for any size milk container, while its coffee spigot height can be adjusted to allow for all different cup sizes--from a classic espresso cup to a tall mug. The unit features an exclusive cup tray to keeps cups warm before use, as well as a three-hour automatic shutoff for safety. For added convenience the unit comes with a water-level indicator, an electronic steam and coffee thermostat, rinse and decalcification auto programs, and a removable drip tray for easy cleanup.  Brewing Unit: The "Heart" of Magnificent 

 

The Magnifica features the smallest removable brewing system available on the market. Because DeLonghi’s patented boiler is so compact, the excellent heat distribution guarantees a perfect espresso at the ideal temperature every time. And, thanks to the removable boiler, cleaning the inside of the machine is easy. Even areas normally difficult to reach can be easily cleaned and without the use of harsh detergents. And because regular maintenance helps prolong the life of the machine, DeLonghi’s reliability is second to none.Beans-to-Brew System

 One of the secrets to making a high-quality espresso is using freshly ground coffee beans. Because of the beans-to-brew system, the Magnifica offers you coffee that has a delicious aroma. The coffee is freshly ground and no traces are left in the machine. Magnifica is the only super-automatic machine that delivers the freshest results. 

 

 Features

 

 * Compact and High Performance: Because DeLonghi’s new patented boiler is so compact, the excellent heat distribution guarantees a perfect espresso at the ideal temperature every time. 
 * Timeless Reliability: Thanks to the stainless-steel removable double boiler, the inside can be cleaned easily. Regular cleaning of the machine is essential for maintaining the best flavor possible and for minimizing the need for service. 
 * A Perfect Aroma, Guaranteed: The beans-to-brew system guarantees an espresso with a delicious aroma as the coffee is freshly ground. No traces of stale grounds are left in the machine. 
 * Instant Reheat: This special function heats the core of Magnifica, ensuring the machine is always at the ideal temperature for espresso, no matter how long the interval between cups. 
 * Removable Water Tank and Bean Container: Magnifica knows that the counter space in your kitchen is always at a premium. Magnifica is the only super-automatic machine that allows you to fill the water tank and empty the coffee grounds without moving the machine. All of the controls are at the front of the machine, from the on/off switch to the cappuccino system. 
 * Integrated Burr Grinder: A space-saver container for beans is fully integrated into the Magnifica. You can set the grinding level to customize your espresso. Magnifica can also be used with ground coffee. DeLonghi recommends the use of illycaffe for the best tasting espresso. Rich, smooth, balanced, and never bitter, illy provides the same consistent distinctive taste cup after cup. 
 * Coffee Spigots: Magnifica’s coffee spigot height can be adjusted to allow for all different cup sizes--from a classic espresso cup to a tall mug. 
 * Cappuccino System: The patented cappuccino system rotates 180 degrees to allow for any size milk container. 
 * Cup Tray: Magnifica’s exclusive cup tray, similar to those found in cafés, keeps cups warm before use. 
 * Front Panel: Magnifica allows you to customize your coffee by adjusting the quantity of water and coffee to suit your taste: Long or short, weak or strong. 
   
   

Technical Data

 * Selection for 1 cup

Easy-to-use rotary and push button control panel with programmable menu settings and beans container capacity is 8.8 ounces. Coffee grounds container- 14 cups or after 72 hours from first use. Maximum cup height- 4.25 inches. Input power - 1350 watts

Grinds beans instantly with the patented, compact and easy-to-clean "Direct-to-Brew" system. Use your favorite coffee beans to create your perfect espresso. Beans with less visible oil, usually a medium roast, are recommended for best grinder performance
